article_title: Paul McHugh: Dr. Death Makes a Comeback
article_text: ‘I guess Jack’s won,” a pal of mine said, alluding to Jack Kevorkian, whose views on physician-assisted suicide are lately back in vogue. With backing from liberal financier George Soros—a longtime supporter of “right to die” legislation—proponents are intent on expanding beyond Oregon, Vermont and Washington the roster of states where the practice is legal. Legislation to allow assisted suicide is moving through New Jersey’s statehouse, last month a New York legislator vowed to introduce a similar bill, and in California state...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Paul McHugh writes that legalizing physician-assisted suicide is receiving fresh support, but doctors should think twice before signing on.
twitter.title: Dr. Death Makes a Comeback
